alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Warren; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 6:32PM EDT until May 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Nash, Warren and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Nashville, Warrenton, Norlina, Dortches, Littleton, Red Oak, Enfield, Princeville, Sharpsburg, Pinetops, Whitakers, Macclesfield, Conetoe, Castalia, Macon, Centerville, Leggett and Glenview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Edgecombe; Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Warren; Wilson
